intro: Symplocos tacanensis, commonly known as the Tacana waxtree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the tropical Andes of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by edible, fleshy berries. Symplocos tacanensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
